org.xchain.framework.util

Class ThreadLocalStack<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.util.ThreadLocalStack<E>

  • public class ThreadLocalStack<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    A stack that has a different state for each thread that uses it.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble, Devon Tackett

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.ThreadLocal<java.util.LinkedList<E>> stackThreadLocal 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ThreadLocalStack() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears the stack.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the stack for this thread is empty, false otherwise.
      E peek()
      Peeks at the element on top of the stack.
      E peek(int depth)
      Peeks at an element in the stack.
      E pop()
      Pops the top element off of the stack and returns it.
      void push(E item)
      Pushes an item onto the top of the stack.
      int size()
      Returns the size of the stack.
      java.util.List<E> toList()
      Return a copy of the current threads stack as a list, with the top of the stack at index 0.

    • Method Detail

      • push

        public void push(E item)
        Pushes an item onto the top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to push onto the stack.

      • pop

        public E pop()
        Pops the top element off of the stack and returns it.
        Returns:
        the top element from the stack.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the stack is empty.

      • peek

        public E peek()
        Peeks at the element on top of the stack. This call is the same as peek(0).
        Returns:
        the element on the top of the stack.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the stack is empty.

      • peek

        public E peek(int depth)
        Peeks at an element in the stack.
        Parameters:
        depth - the depth of the element to peek at.
        Returns:
        the element at depth in the stack.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if there is not an element at depth in the stack.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of the stack.
        Returns:
        the size of the stack.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the stack for this thread is empty, false otherwise.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the stack.

      • toList

        public java.util.List<E> toList()
        Return a copy of the current threads stack as a list, with the top of the stack at index 0.
